settings.title: Feel and move your best with Hydration Drops
settings.subtitle: Hydrate and mineralize at the cellular level with the drinks you're already drinking.
settings.bullet_1_text: Losing as little as 2% of key electrolytes and fluids can significantly impair physical and mental performance. When you exercise, you lose 6-10%.
settings.bullet_2_text: At universities in East London and Westminster, students who hydrated while taking an exam improved their scores by 5% over their dried-out classmates.
settings.bullet_3_text: Even the healthiest people show mood changes when mildly dehydrated. In men, dehydration promotes feelings of anxiety and nervousness; in women, sluggishness and brain fog are more common.
settings.bullet_4_text: Insufficient micronutrient and mineral levels are triggers for appetite and hunger. Our all-natural, hand-harvested sea salt has 87 micronutrients and trace-minerals.
settings.bullet_5_text: Staying hydrated with fluid and electrolytes is the foundation for normal immune function and promotes your body's ability to detox. Our added vitamins and herbal extracts provide a robust antioxidant boost.
settings.bullet_6_text: When digested, the alcohol you ingest breaks down into acetaldehyde, an exponentially more toxic byproduct you need extra nutrition to break down efficiently. Mix Buoy‚Äôs essential electrolytes and B vitamins in with your fun to feel better the next day.

settings.title: A better way to feel better with Immunity Drops
settings.subtitle: Add comprehensive immune support and cellular hydration with the drinks you‚Äôre already drinking.
settings.bullet_1_text: Soothe and reduce inflammation with potent antioxidants from Buoy's herbal extracts and vitamins.
settings.bullet_2_text: Balance your cellular immune response to prevent damage from an overactive immune system.
settings.bullet_3_text: Protect against unstable molecules that form daily when exposed to environmental hazards like air pollution and UV.
settings.bullet_4_text: Remove cellular debris and foreign substances with nutrition that supports specialized immune cells called neutrophils and macrophages.
settings.bullet_5_text: Support with functional herbal extracts and powerful antioxidants that've been used medically for centuries.
settings.bullet_6_text: Staying hydrated is the foundation for a healthy immune system. Our vitamins and herbal extracts take it a step further.

settings.title: Never skip a beat with Energy Drops
settings.subtitle: Add no-jitters, mood-enhancing energy stacked with cellular hydration to the drinks you're already drinking.
settings.bullet_1_text: Unlike coffee grounds, Green tea contains the amino acid L-Theanine which changes how your body processes caffeine for a gentler, more sustained energy boost without the crash.
settings.bullet_2_text: L-Theanine works synergistically with caffeine to improve brain function, which has shown to be especially beneficial for learning, memory and focus.
settings.bullet_3_text: Relax the mind without losing the buzz. Green tea‚Äôs potent combo of caffeine and L-Theanine work in tandem to keep you alert, focused and calm.
settings.bullet_4_text: Green tea contains caffeine, which increases your body‚Äôs energy use, and a specific flavonoid called catechin, which helps break down fat. Together, these compounds speed up your metabolism.
settings.bullet_5_text: Running into that midday wall is classic dehydration. Address the root cause, not the symptom, with the electrolytes of 13 sports drinks in each bottle
settings.bullet_6_text: Green Tea is packed with antioxidants including the notoriously powerful EGCg, which comes with a slew of cardiovascular and metabolic benefits.

settings.title: Waking Up
settings.text: You wake up dehydrated. Wake up on the right side of the bed by adding a hydration boost to your morning routine.

settings.title: Working Out
settings.text: Losing just 2% of fluids and key electrolytes can impact physical performance. When you exercise, you lose 6-10%.

settings.title: Midday Motivator
settings.text: Sharpen productivity and keep motivation high after lunch with electrolytes, minerals and B vitamins.

settings.title: The 2pm Wall
settings.text: That midday wall is classic dehydration. Address the root symptoms with hydration, not just another coffee.

settings.title: On the Go
settings.text: When air is dry, like in low-humidity airplane cabins, your throats's cilia is much less effective at fending off viruses and bacteria, making you more vulnerable to getting sick. Fortify your immune system with hydration on the go.

settings.title: Happy Hour
settings.text: Give your body what it needs to break down acetaldehyde alcohol's toxic byproduct, while you're drinking. Mix Buoy in with the fun to feel better the next day.

settings.title: Bedtime
settings.text: Wind down with the last beverage before bed by adding our deep-sleep promoting sea salt to catch some quality Zs.

settings.title: Healthy habits made easy
settings.text: Stack cellular hydration, ionic trace minerals and functional ingredients with your daily rituals.

settings.name: 87 Trace Ionic Minerals
settings.fast_fact: An estimated 90% of Americans are mineral deficient.
settings.important:
Modern agricultural practices have stripped the Earth's soil of these essential minerals, making them harder to obtain through food alone.

Think of ionic trace minerals as the energy-bunny nutrients that support optimal cardiovascular, nervous system and cognitive functioning.

Even minor deficiencies can impact your ability to absorb and use nutrients.

settings.name: Sodium
settings.fast_fact: Although sodium gets a bad rap for cardiovascular health, you shouldn‚Äôt avoid it entirely. Your body needs it to function. Instead, focus on choosing better sources of sodium that aren‚Äôt processed or manufactured.
settings.important: Sodium maintains fluid balance through osmosis. Without proper amounts, you‚Äôre either losing more water than you can take in (dehydration), or consuming more water than your body can get rid of (hypervolemia). Both are bad.

settings.name: Chloride
settings.fast_fact: Chloride combines with hydrogen in your stomach to make hydrochloric acid, a powerful enzyme responsible for the breakdown of proteins and the absorption of minerals and vitamin B12.
settings.important: Chloride is one of three principle electrolytes and plays a key role in keeping your fluids balanced. Without enough chloride in your body, you won‚Äôt be able to properly balance your fluids.

settings.name: Potassium
settings.fast_fact: Potassium is one of three principal electrolytes and is the third most abundant mineral in our bodies.
settings.important: Potassium plays an irreplaceable role in maintaining optimal fluid balance. Cells in our body require proper water balance to function properly, which is where potassium‚Äôs hydrating properties really shine.

settings.name: Vitamin B1
settings.fast_fact: Every tissue in your body needs vitamin B1 to function. Your body doesn‚Äôt produce this essential B vitamin on its own.
settings.important: Vitamin B1 is a key component to helping electrolytes flow in and out of cells. It also supports proper functioning of your nervous system, muscles and major organs like your brain, heart and stomach.

settings.name: Blood Orange
settings.fast_fact: In just 3.4fl oz of natural blood orange juice, you can get 40% of your recommended daily dose of Vitamin C.
settings.important: One blood orange has the antioxidant quenching capacity of 2kg of navel oranges, making it great at fighting free radicals responsible for heart disease, degenerative diseases and aging.

settings.name: Magnesium
settings.fast_fact: Over 50% of Americans are magnesium deficient. Even with a health diet, you may not be getting enough of it.
settings.important: Magnesium helps the intracellular transport of sodium and potassium throughout your cells, meaning you‚Äôll get more out of your electrolytes with it in your diet. Every cell in your body needs it to function. More than 300 nerve impulses enzymatic reactions require magnesium as a cofactor.

settings.name: Vitamin B5
settings.fast_fact: Vitamin B5 is necessary for making blood cells, making it one of the most important vitamins to sustain human life.
settings.important: You need vitamin B5 to synthesize and metabolize fats, proteins and coenzyme A. Coenzyme A converts foods into fatty acids and cholesterol and is needed to deliver chemical messages inside our cells. Your liver needs coenzyme A to metabolize drugs and toxins safely.

settings.name: Vitamin B6
settings.fast_fact: B6 is often lacking in the American diet. Your body doesn‚Äôt produce Vitamin B6 on its own, so you need to get it from food or supplements.
settings.important: You need vitamin B6 to create the neurotransmitters that regulate emotions like serotonin, dopamine and gamma-aminobutyric acid (GABA). It also decreases high blood levels of homocysteine, which is linked to depression.

settings.name: Star Anise
settings.fast_fact: Typically, each star-shaped fruit has 8 points. It‚Äôs known for its culinary applications and medicinal properties.
settings.important: Star Anise is rich in flavonoids and polyphenols. Some of its health-promoting compounds make it a powerful antioxidant, anti-viral, anti-inflammatory and anti-microbial.

settings.name: Acacia
settings.fast_fact: It tends to make you full, so you may reduce the chance of overeating, and is linked to weight loss and lower cholesterol levels.
settings.important: Medicinally, acacia treats chronic illnesses like diabetes, IBS and obesity. It‚Äôs a prebiotic used to remove toxins from the body and promote good gut bacteria in your intestines.

settings.name: Rosemary
settings.fast_fact: Limited but promising studies show rosemary helps prevent brain aging. It may protect against damage and improve recovery from a stroke.
settings.important: Rosemary is a rich source of antioxidants and anti-inflammatory compounds that improve your immune system and circulation. These properties fight free radicals.

settings.title: Clean, functional ingredients
settings.text:
Formulated by a leading pharmaceutical expert to transform any beverage into a deeply hydrating, functional beverage with essential minerals and vitamins.

When we expand our product line, we add functional ingredients to our baseline hydration formula below.

settings.name: Green Tea
settings.important:
Green Tea is renown for being lush with antioxidants. 

Specifically, the antioxidant ECGC has neuro-protective properties that shield brain cells from oxidative stress and promote memory retention and improved task performance.

Green Tea extract is linked to weight loss, boosted liver function, performance recovery and healthier skin. 

The antioxidant ECGC is also being studied for its anti-cancer properties.

settings.name: L-Theanine
settings.fast_fact: L-Theanine is only found naturally in green and black teas and specific mushrooms.
settings.important:
Promotes a calm, attentive wakefulness through enhanced alpha brain waver activity and increased synthesis of GABA. 

Consumption mitigates the mental and physical negative effects from stress.

L-Theanine changes how your body metabolizes caffeine for a seemingly gentler, long-lasting energy boost.

settings.name: Vitamin C
settings.fast_fact: Our bodies need Vitamin C to produce collagen, a protein that helps wounds heal.
settings.important: Free radicals are unstable molecules that form when our bodies convert food into energy. We are also exposed to free radicals from cigarettes, air pollution, UV sunlight, and other environmental hazards. Vitamin C is an antioxidant that helps protect our cells from harm caused by free radicals. It‚Äôs one of the best nutrients for helping fight off infections and giving our immune systems a boost when we need it most.

settings.name: Vitamin D3
settings.fast_fact: Only a handful of foods in nature naturally contain Vitamin D. Most food and beverage products that contain Vitamin D, like milk, are fortified with it.
settings.important:
Think of Vitamin D as an equalizer for the immune system, especially helping our immune systems stay balanced during the cold and flu season. If our immune systems have too much stimulation, autoimmune diseases can set in. With too little immune system activity, infections are more likely. In people that have low levels of vitamin D, both of these extremes have been shown to be more prevalent.

In 2009, the National Institute of Health stated that low Vitamin D levels are associated with frequent colds and influenza.

settings.name: Zinc
settings.fast_fact: Consuming Zinc supplements within 24 hours after cold symptoms appear may reduce how long the symptoms last and could make symptoms less severe.
settings.important:
Zinc signals what type of immune cells should be produced to support the healing process.

During the first stage of healing after injury or infection, we need zinc to bring in specialized immune cells called neutrophils and macrophages. 

These cells are our first line of defense and will help get rid of foreign substances and clean up cellular debris.

settings.name: Ginger Root
settings.fast_fact: Ginger has been used for thousands of years to treat colds, nausea, arthritis, migraines, and hypertension. During the 13th and 14th century, you could buy a sheep by paying with one pound of ginger.
settings.important:
Within Ginger is Gingerol, a powerful antioxidant and anti-inflammatory compound with strong immune building properties.

Ginger can stimulate the immune system to kill viruses. 

It's antibacterial properties even offers benefits against some drug-resistant bacteria, studies show.

settings.name: Elderberry
settings.fast_fact: Elderberries are the fruit of the Sambucus tree. Native Americans and European herbalists have long used elderberries for their supposed range of health benefits.
settings.important:
Elderberries are packed with antioxidants and vitamins, making it a common supplement people reach for when feeling under the weather.

Consumption helps reduce inflammation, reduce stress and may protect your heart.

settings.name: Echinacea
settings.fast_fact: Echinacea comes from the Greek word ‚Äúechinos‚Äù, which translates to sea urchin. It's commonly referred to as a sea urchin flower because of its appearance.
settings.important:
Echinacea can increase the number of white blood cells in our bodies, which are needed to fight infections. 

The main active parts of Echinacea include alkylamides, caffeic acid derivatives and polysaccharides, which account for its antiviral, anti-microbial and anti-inflammatory properties.

settings.name: B Vitamins
settings.fast_fact: Every tissue in your body needs B vitamins to function. Your body doesn‚Äôt produce them on its own.
settings.important:
B vitamins are key component to helping electrolytes flow in and out of cells. 

They support proper functioning of your nervous system, muscles and major organs like your brain, heart and stomach.

B vitamins are a naturally energy boost.

settings.name: Vitamin A
settings.fast_fact: Based on studies of the potential roles of Vitamin A in reversing tumor development and boosting immune function, it has been suggested that Vitamin A might help reduce cancer risk.
settings.important:
Vitamin A is known as an anti-inflammatory vitamin and has regulatory roles in cellular immune responses and humoral immune processes. It's crucial to a mechanism that occurs in the digestive system and leads to immune tolerance across the entire gut lining which is the crutch of good health. The gut is where many people first lose immune tolerance.

Vitamin A has exhibited a therapeutic effect in the treatment of various infectious diseases.

settings.name: Vitamin E
settings.fast_fact: Vitamin E is found in nature in eight different forms: four tocopherols and four tocotrienols. Alpha tocopherol is the main type of Vitamin E within our bodies and thus referred to as the most important of all the different forms.
settings.important:
Vitamin E is a primary defense factor preventing oxidative damage and protecting cell membranes. 

As a powerful antioxidant, it helps cells fight off infection by neutralizing harmful free radicals - molecules that can damage cells and may contribute to chronic diseases. 

When consumed with Vitamin C, studies show Vitamin D3 further reduces oxidative stress.

settings.title: Is it really flavorless?
settings.answer:
Electrolytes, vitamins, and ionic trace minerals are bitter by nature. That‚Äôs why traditional sports drinks and hydration supplements use sugar and sweeteners to offset their intense taste.

Finding the balance between effective, clean ingredients and a neutral flavor profile took our team of scientists two years to get right. With a proper dosage in a full drink, you should notice little to no taste.

settings.title: What kind of testing do you do?
settings.answer:
All Buoy products are third-party tested.

All products are tested for impurities like toxins, microbes, metals, allergens and other contaminants. We also test for shelf-stability and accurate nutrition labels.

For every product we create, we publish whitepapers highlighting their efficacy and safety.

settings.title: How long until I see results?
settings.answer:
Buoy‚Äôs hard-to-find essential nutrients are important for foundational health in the long run.

Depending on how chronically dehydrated you are when you start Buoy will affect how intense of a feeling you might notice. Headaches, cramping, midday fatigue, grogginess and drier skin are all symptoms of dehydration.

While a lot of people using Buoy notice results after about a week of consistent use, some don‚Äôt‚Äîand that‚Äôs okay.

It can take up to a month or two for your body to reach a new normal. Rest assured, our high bioavailable and fast-absorbing ingredients get to work quickly and target nutrient gaps in the American diet.

settings.title: How does the Clear Pee Club work?
settings.answer:
Never run dry with our flexible subscription plan.

Buoy‚Äôs ingredient panel supports foundational health with hydration and minerals that work at the cellular level. We created a product important for daily life. We centered our business model around long-term discounts that help you build healthy habits.

Before each shipment, we‚Äôll send you an email and text to make sure you‚Äôre ready. Rush, delay or cancel your subscription at any time, right from your phone or laptop.

Try our subscription risk free. If we‚Äôre not a good fit after your first month, we‚Äôll give you a full refund.

settings.title: Will Buoy break my fast?
settings.answer:
Nope ü§†.

We‚Äôre talking to you, keto and intermittent fasting dieters. We formulated all Buoy products to be a sidekick to any diet, specifically those looking to stay in ketosis or a fasting state.

settings.title: Why do other products have larger serving sizes?
settings.answer:
Hydration is a turtle‚Äôs race‚Äîslow and steady wins.
Your body will pass most of the nutrients in large, single-serving doses before you can actually use them.

Our approach to hydration is backed by our body's biochemisty and formulated for daily dehydration.

We use high bioavailable and fast-absorbing ingredient sources so you're able to get the most out of every drop.

Each bottle has the electrolyte equivalent of 13 sports drinks, without the junk.

settings.title: Does this have caffeine?
settings.answer:
Only our Energy Drops contain caffeine, the others do not.

Each serving of Energy Drops has 30mg, or roughly a third of a cup of coffee.
